Covington High School is pleased to honor two valedictorians for the Class of 2020: Josie Schaurer and Hailey Weer. Both students have earned this distinction by graduating with an impressive perfect 4.0 grade point average. (We will highlight Josie today and Hailey on Wednesday.)

Valedictorian Josie Kate Schaurer is the daughter of Diana and John Schaurer. Josie will attend Indiana Wesleyan University with a major in Art Education. Josie is looking forward to being an art teacher, as she envisions that “art teachers get to be immersed in something they love all day, and they get to teach others how to love and appreciate something so important to our world.”

Josie’s school activities include participation in Art Club, Drama Club, Key Club, Spanish Club, Jazz Band, Marching Band, Student Council, the PLUS Overnighter Team, and National Honor Society. She also attended the Hugh O’Brian Youth Leadership Conference and volunteers often in the community, church, and at Covington Elementary School.

Congratulations to CHS Valedictorian Josie Schaurer!

However, if parents are unable to pick up the meals, the district will certainly deliver them.

If you have any questions, please feel free to call 937-473-2249.

A few months ago, Bill Heath from the Covington Fraternal Order of the Eagles stopped by the Board office and dropped off an $8,000 donation! That surprise donation was used to support the CHS Art Department, the CHS Science Department, and the CES Physical Education Department. Some of the items purchased were: a pottery wheel, clay shaper sets, tool canisters, sensors for labs covering conductivity, voltage, gas pressure, and direct temperature, a trebuchet, elementary age appropriate sporting equipment (such as volleyballs, soccer balls, batting tees, rackets, tennis balls, etc.), an equipment cart, and much more. In addition, this money was used to fund the CES Muse Machine Artist in Residence program!

Thank you Covington Eagles! Your generosity has provided our students with some much needed equipment and some fantastic educational experiences!

These fun activities helped the students with their cutting skills, their fine motor skills, counting, letter recognition, name recognition, and more. Well done preschoolers!
